block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
Music and Dance

Brookville Works by Wagner, Shostakovich and Grieg, presented by the Long Island Philharmonic Orchestra, with Jon Nakamatsu, piano. Jan. 21 at 7:30 p.m. $38 to $68. The Hamburg Symphony, conducted by Andrey Boreyko, with Robert McDuffie, violin. Jan. 27 at 8 p.m. $45 to $90. Tilles Center for the Performing Arts, 720 Northern Boulevard, C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University. (516) 299-3100.
Farmingdale The Rivalry, with Fight of Your Life and Push Play, rock. Jan. 27 at 5 p.m. $10 to $13. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.

Great River Pierrot Consort, with Susan Deaver, flute; Maureen Hynes, cello; Heawon Kim, piano; Veronica Salas, viola, and Dale Stuckenbruck, violin. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. Daniel Lippel, classical guitar. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Both free. Bayard Cutting Arboretum State Park, 440 Montauk Highway. (631) 224-5420.
Holbrook The Devotions, pop. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Free. Sachem Public Library, 150 Holbrook Library. (631) 588-5024.
Huntington Strunz and Farah, guitar duo. Friday at 9 p.m. $37.50; members, $28.50. Inter-Media Art Center, 370 New York Avenue. (631) 549-2787.
Huntington The Wiyos, ragtime and jug band. Jan. 27 at 8:30 p.m. $15; seniors and students, $13. Last Licks Cafe, Unitarian Fellowship, 109 Brown's Road. (631) 427-9547.
Long Beach Long Island Classical Ensemble, Baroque music. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Both free. Long Beach Public Library, 111 West Park Avenue. (516) 432-7201.

North Bellmore Rossini's ''Stabat Mater'' and Haydn's Mass in D minor presented by the Merrick Chorale, directed by Richard Gilley. Jan. 21 at 2:30 p.m. Bellmore Presbyterian Church, Corner of Martin and Bellmore Avenues. (516) 378-2285.
Northport ''Doing Music,'' presented by Christopher Morrongiello, lute. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Northport Public Library, 151 Laurel Avenue. (631) 261-6930.
Oceanside Good Vibrations, Len Hirsch, guitar, and Tom Rizzuto, vibraphone. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. Free; tickets required. Oceanside Library, 30 Davison Avenue. (516) 766-2360.
Patchogue Janaki String Quartet, chamber music. Jan. 21 at 3 p.m. $15; seniors and students, $12. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.
Roslyn Heights Rick Recht, rock. Jan. 27 at 6 p.m. Free. Temple Sinai, 425 Roslyn Road. (516) 621-6800.

Smithtown ''Basic Hustle Workshop,'' no partner necessary; beginners welcome. Friday at 6:45 p.m. Donation: $5. ''Traditional New England Barn Dance,'' presented by the Long Island Traditional Music Association. Friday, 8 to 11 p.m. $10; seniors, $9; students, $5; children to 16, free. Smithtown Historical Society, 211 Main Street. (631) 369-7854.
St. James Jazz in the Living Room, jazz improvisation. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $5 to play; free to listen. Mills Pond House Gallery, 660 Route 25A. (631) 862-6575.

Stony Brook ''A Thousand and One Nights,'' performed by the State Ballet Theater of Russia. Jan. 27 at 8 p.m. $40; children 12 and under, $20. The New Century Saxophone Quartet. Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. $32. Staller Center for the Arts, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-2787.
Stony Brook Ellis Paul with Antje Duvekot, folk. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. $25; students, $20. University Cafe, Stony Brook Union Building, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-6027.

Stony Brook ''A Concert of Chamber Music,'' presented by the North Shore Pro Musica. Jan. 28 at 5 p.m. $15; students, $10. Ward Melville Heritage Educational and Cultural Center, Main Street. (631) 473-5220.
Theater
Bohemia ''Godspell'' by Stephen Schwartz and John-Michael Tebelak. Through Jan. 28. $14 to $20. Airport Playhouse, 218 Knickerbocker Avenue. (631) 589-7588.

East Farmingdale ''Happy Birthday Bridgit,'' comedy by Marc Camoletti. Through Feb. 4. $18 to $22. ''How the Other Half Loves,'' by Alan Ayckbourn. Through Jan. 21. $16 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
Hempstead ''Quartet'' by Ronald Harwood, directed by Bob Spiotto. Through Jan. 28. $18; seniors and students, $16. Emily and Jerry Spiegel Theater, Hofstra University, South Campus. (516) 463-6644.
Oakdale ''High School Musical,'' musical adapted from the film by Kenny Ortega. Through Jan. 28. $12. CM Performing Arts Center, 931 Montauk Highway. (631) 218-2810.

Quogue Edward Albee's ''Everything in the Garden,'' presented by the Hampton Theater Company, directed by Sarah Hunnewell. Through Jan. 28. $10 to $20. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
Film

Bay Shore ''The Philadelphia Story,'' directed by George Cukor. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $5. ''Dead End,'' directed by William Wyler, followed by book signing with Leonard Getz, author of ''From Broadway to the Bowery.'' Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. $8. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.

East Hampton ''Hawaii, Oslo,'' directed by Erik Poppe; in Norwegian with English subtitles. Jan. 21 at 7 p.m. ''Day Break,'' directed by Hamid Rahmanian; in Persian with English subtitles. Jan. 28 at 7 p.m. Both free. Guild Hall, 158 Main Street. (631) 324-4050.
Freeport ''Freedomland,'' directed by Joe Roth. Friday at 3 and 7 p.m. Free. Freeport Memorial Library, 144 West Merrick Road. (516) 379-3274.

Huntington Asian Cinevisions: ''Who's Camus Anyway?'' directed by Mitsuo Yanagimachi; in Japanese with English subtitles. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $4.50 to $9. American Icons: ''Nashville,'' directed by Robert Altman. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $9. ''Buffalo Bill and the Indians, or Sitting Bull's History Lesson,'' directed by Robert Altman. Jan. 28 at 11 a.m.; bagel breakfast at 10 a.m. $13; members, $10; reservations recommended. ''China Blue,'' documentary about the Chinese garment industry directed by Micha X. Peled, guest speaker. Jan. 28 at 2:30 p.m. $12; members, $8. Cinema Arts Center, 423 Park Avenue. (631) 423-7611.

Sag Harbor ''Cool Hand Luke,'' directed by Stuart Rosenberg. Friday at 8 p.m. The Picture Show: ''Rocky,'' directed by John G. Avildsen. Jan. 27 at 8 p.m. $5. Bay Street Theater, Main and Bay Streets. (631) 725-9500.

Westhampton Beach ''For Your Consideration,'' directed by Christopher Guest. Jan. 21 at 1 and 4 p.m. ''The Painted Veil,'' directed by John Curran. Friday and Jan. 27 at 7:30 p.m.; Jan. 28 at 1 and 4 p.m. $3 to $10. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
Outdoors
East Norwich ''Special Places at Muttontown,'' guided hike to sites on the preserve. Jan. 21 at 10 a.m. $3; reservations required. Muttontown Preserve, Muttontown Lane. (516) 571-8500.

Long Beach Nature Center Seal Walks, introductory program and walk to view wintering seals. Jan. 27 at 10:30 a.m. $3; free, children under 3. Theodore Roosevelt Nature Center, Ocean Parkway. (516) 679-7254.
Spoken Word

Huntington Stuart R. Levine, author of ''Cut to the Chase.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Lisa Drayer, author of ''Strong, Slim and 30.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.
Plainview Barbara Reiher-Meyers, poet. Jan. 21 at 7 p.m. Free. Mid-Island Y Jewish Community Center, 45 Manetto Hill Road. (516) 822-3535.
Sagaponack Charlotte Frieze, author of ''The Zone Garden.'' Jan. 21 at 11 a.m. $45; members, $35. Madoo Conservancy, 618 Sagg Main Street. (631) 537-8200.
For Children
Bridgehampton ''Build a Butterfly Life-Cycle Mobile.'' Ages 4 to 7. Jan. 27 at 10 a.m. $5; members, free. South Fork Natural History Museum, 377 Bridgehampton/Sag Harbor Turnpike. (631) 537-9735.

Dix Hills ''Peter Pan'' by James M. Barrie, Mark Charlap and Carolyn Leigh, directed by Tony Frangipane and performed by fifth-grade students. Jan. 27 at 4 p.m. and Jan. 28 at 1 p.m. $10; seniors and students, $5. Eugene Orloff Auditorium, East High School, 50 Vanderbilt Parkway. (631) 592-3185.

Garden City ''Passion and Fire,'' family classical music concert presented by Chamber Players International. Ages 4 and up. Jan. 21 at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. ''Music Makes Me Happy,'' presented by Robbi K and Friends. Jan. 27 at 1 and 3 p.m.; Jan. 28 at 1 and 3 p.m. $3.50. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Glen Cove ''Oratorio Terezin'' by Ruth Fazel, a musical about the Terezin ghetto and an introduction to the Holocaust for children ages 6 to 12 and their families. Jan. 21 at 1:30 p.m. Free; reservations recommended. Holocaust Memorial and Tolerance Center, 100 Crescent Beach Road. (516) 571-8040.

Islip ''Peter Pan and Wendy,'' presented by BroadHollow Theater; followed by a princess tea party. Jan. 27 at 2 p.m. $8; $20 for show and tea party. Registration required. BayWay Arts Center, 265 East Main Street. (631) 581-2700.

Kings Park ''Brr Winter is Here!'' Learn how animals stay warm in winter. Ages 5 and up. Jan. 27 at 2 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Nissequogue River State Park, St. Johnland Road. (631) 269-4927.
Massapequa Special Youth Concert, presented by the Massapequa Philharmonic Orchestra, with Greta Hayes, cello. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Berner Middle School, Carmans Mill Road. (516) 795-4071.
Northport ''Museum Cove for Preschoolers,'' storytelling, songs and crafts. Ages 3 to 5. Jan. 27 at 10 a.m. Free. Northport Public Library, 151 Laurel Avenue. (631) 261-6930.

Oakdale ''Star Gazing.'' Observe winter constellations; bring a blanket. All Ages. Friday at 7 p.m. ''A Trout is Born.'' Tour the trout hatchery. All Ages. Jan. 27 at 9:30 a.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.

Port Washington ''Ferdinand the Bull,'' presented by the Hudson Vagabond Puppet Theater. Jan. 27 at 2 p.m. $15; members, $13. Jeanne Rimsky Theater at the Landmark on Main Street, 232 Main Street. (516) 767-6444.

Riverhead ''Science Fair Fun,'' ideas and instructions for sample science fair projects. Jan. 21, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. ''Pinwheels and Parachutes.'' Make parachutes by testing a variety of materials. Jan. 28, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Both: $2; children, $5. Long Island Science Center, 11 West Main Street. (631) 208-8000.

Smithtown ''Candle Making 101,'' family program to make drip candles; bring empty soup can. All ages. Jan. 28 at 1:30 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Caleb Smith State Park Preserve, Jericho Turnpike. (631) 265-1054.

Westbury ''Third Annual Winterfest,'' magic show, wild animal visits, food, gardening and craft activities. All ages. Jan. 27 and 28 from 9 am to 4 p.m. Free. Hicks Nurseries, 100 Jericho Turnpike. (516) 334-0066.
Museums and Galleries

Riverhead ''Ice Age: Revisited,'' exhibition featuring animals that lived during the ice age. Through March 18. $11; seniors and children 12 to 18, $9; children 3 to 11, $8; children under 2, free. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.

Rockville Centre Exhibition of work by the Long Island Black Artist Association. Jan. 27 through March 3. Reception: Jan. 27, 3 to 5 p.m. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Molloy College Art Gallery, 1000 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 678-5000.

Southampton ''2007 School Art Festival,'' works by students from pre-K through eighth grade. Jan. 27 through March 4. Festival opening with face painting, music and balloon art, Jan. 27, 3 to 5 p.m. $7; seniors and students, $5; children under 18, free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.
